channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Light pollution from P7 50, outside 247 BR4 0HJ, 3rd November
item.description:
The light from this tall lamp on PIckhurst Lane is emitted outwards, as well as down, towards the road. Strange though it might seem, it shines directly into the rear first floor bedroom at 247 BR4 0BJ and I would like it to be fitted with a baffle to prevent this continuing. I would appreciate personal contact by someone at Bromley Council to discuss this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickhurst Lane, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep hallow in footpath, 3rd November
item.description:
Nearly tripped in the dark when I stepped into this, not seeing how deep it was. The photo with the car gives an idea of how deep this is. Please fix this before someone does trip and injure themselves. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12-14, Tavistock Street, Holborn, London

item.title: Car has been loaded with household rubbish and dumped, 3rd November
item.description:
The car, which is new to the street has been abandoned and left unmoving for several weeks. It was left filled with what I think is unwanted household contents. It is on the lower half of Durham Rise opposite Bramblebury Road and in front of houses number 25 and 27 Durham Rise.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Rise, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 30 seater coaches all day every day of the week sitting outside Westminster Choir School, 3rd November
item.description:
White 30 seater coaches arrive and depart Westminster Choir Schools every day of the week. They park and run their engines, the maximum time recorded was 47mins. Once I spoke with a driver who's responce was "I'm heating the bus for the children. The 30 seater coaches every day is also severely blocking a very narrow road and not abling other vehicles to be able to pass by resulting in sever congestion every day. The large coaches are also blocking access to the black gates of the housing estate next door for bin removal daily. The parents also block the pavement every day three times, forcing residents to have to walk in the road, which we have to navigate two 30 seater coaches. The engine idling daily is having a serious determental effect to our residents homes and the streets flowing traffic and residents from being able to have our bins emptied and being able to park our cars and depart/arrive at our homes. The noise of beeping vehicles trying to pass and the engines has now become unbearable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Francis Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thames Water roadworks, 3rd November
item.description:
Thames Water have been doing road works on this road for over 2 years. Each time they reach the end of their deadline they extend it. Please can you help being this to an end? It’s completely unreasonable. We want the road put back to normal.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 145, Vulcan Road, New Cross, London

item.title: Filthy road, 3rd November
item.description:
Ceres Road hasn’t been swept in months. It’s filthy! There is rubbish everywhere that is attracting rats and foxes. Rubbish all over the street. Piles of leaves everywhere. Please can the council come and sweep it, I have seen multiple requests on here that have been ignored.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ceres Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Urgent Request for Leaf Clearance on Our Street, 3rd November
item.description:
I’m writing to bring to council’s attention the current state of our street, which is lined with poplar trees that are now shedding their leaves for autumn. The pavements have become heavily covered with fallen leaves, creating both an unsightly mess and a potential slipping hazard for pedestrians, especially in wet conditions. Could the council please arrange for urgent sweeping and maintenance to clear the leaves and ensure the pavements are safe for everyone? Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thurlby Road, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
